Cochlear nucleus (dorsal) unipolar brush.LocationOfLocalAxonArborization: within the same granule cell domain as the cell body
Cochlear nucleus (dorsal) unipolar brush.DendriteLocation: Brush of dendrites is short and lies near the cell body
Cochlear nucleus (dorsal) unipolar brush.Definition: Unipolar brush cells are characterized by having one dendrite that terminates in a paintbrush-like structure of dendrioles that receives input from a single mossy fiber terminal.  The axon usually emanates from the opposite pole, branches 1-3 times and ends in mossy terminals.  They were defined by E. Mugnaini and his colleagues in the 1990s.
